intro: Sida exstipularis, commonly known as the smallleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy, narrow leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. It produces small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind. Sida exstipularis is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
